summary: Retrieve inventory information for multiple products or SKUs
description:
Retrieve inventory information for multiple products or SKUs. Note:  - Searches can be based on either product IDs or SKU IDs, not both at the same time. - Passing Product IDs returns the inventory information of all SKUs under the specified products. - Passing SKU IDs returns the inventory information for the specified SKUs. Version
202309
  
API Testing Tool

query.description: Use this property to pass shop information in requesting the API. Failure in passing the correct value when requesting the API for cross-border shops will return incorrect response.  Get by API Get Authorization Shop
Every single app will have a unique key. Please use the specific key assigned to your app.
Signature generated by gen algorithm. When you send API requests to TTS, you must sign them so that TTS can identify the senders.
Unix timestamp GMT (UTC+00:00). This timestamp is used across all API requests. Developers can use this convert to local time.

header.description: The seller access_token value from Get Access Token, when user_type = 0. Follow this guide to get seller access_token.

body.description: A list of product IDs used to search for inventory information. Max IDs: 100
A list of SKU IDs used to search for inventory information. Max IDs: 600  Note: If both sku_ids and product_ids are passed, sku_ids will take precedence.

schema.description: The success or failure status code returned in API response.
The success or failure messages returned in API response. Reasons of failure will be described in the message.

children.description: Inventory information for the requested products or SKUs.
The ID of the requested product.
The list of requested SKUs.
The SKU ID generated by TikTok Shop.
An internal code/name for managing SKUs, not visible to buyers.
The total number of units available for ordering across all warehouses. It is the sum of the warehouse_inventory.available_quantity values in all warehouses.

The total number of units reserved by existing customer orders across all warehouses (and therefore not available for ordering). It is the sum of the warehouse_inventory.committed_quantity values in all warehouses.
SKU warehouse inventory information.
The ID of the warehouse where the SKU is stored.  Retrieve details of the warehouse from the Get Warehouse List API.
The total number of units available for ordering in this warehouse. This is equivalent to the inventory.quantity value returned in the Get Product API.
The total number of units reserved by existing customer orders in this warehouse (and therefore not available for ordering).
The distribution of the total available inventory for the SKU across different channels.
Inventory that is allocated to a specific campaign.
The number of units allocated.
The name of the associated campaign.
Inventory that is allocated to TikTok creators.
The number of units allocated.
The name of the associated TikTok creator.
The remaining inventory available for the shop after deducting those allocated for campaigns and creators.
The number of units allocated.

error_codes.message: the number of SKU exceed the limit
